intro: Marcellia villosa, commonly known as the hairy marcellia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which are covered in fine, white pubescence. Its showy, pink to purple flowers bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Marcellia villosa is often found in moist, sunny habitats like meadows and wetlands.
